Pre-Game Insights: Croatia will be aiming to bounce back to winning ways after suffering a narrow loss against Portugal to begin their run in the competition.
Poland secured a thrilling 3-2 victory over Scotland to begin the competition on a positive note.
Luka Modric considered amongst the best midfielders of the last decade is still mesmerizing the fans with his top-level performance.
Robert Lewandowski is in his prime form this season after opening the new season with four goals in four matches for Barcelona.
Croatia are unbeaten in their last four home matches.
Poland have won just once in their last four matches.
Croatia are unbeaten in their last three matches against Poland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kick-Off: Sunday, 8 September 2024 at 7:45 PM UK
Tip 1: Match to end with total goals over 3.5– 2/1 with sky bet
Tip 2: The match to end in a draw– 14/5 with bet365
Tip 3: Both the teams to score goals – 8/11 with William HILL
Others: Croatia will be without the services of Lovro Majer, Josip Stanisic and Martin Erlic through injuries.
Duje Caleta-Car will be aiming to start here after putting in an impressive performance off the bench against Portugal.
Zlatko Dalic will likely make some changes after a strong second-half showing from his team in the last game.
Poland have all the players available in their squad except for Arkadiusz Milik and Jakub Kiwior who are ruled out due to injury.
Kiwior was subbed off in the last match.
